intro: Bryomorphe zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a simple structure with leaf-like structures called phyllidia and lacks true roots, stems, or vascular tissue. It reproduces through spores released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Bryomorphe zeyheri plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
